meanings.sent1: She was paupering her friend by lending money she couldn't afford to lose.
meanings.sent2: The greedy landlord was paupering his tenants by raising the rent beyond reason.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf was paupering the villagers by magically turning their gold into leaves.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis was paupering families across the country, leaving them with nothing.
meanings.sent5: The cruel stepmother was paupering Cinderella by forcing her to work day and night without pay.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing someone to poverty.
meanings.sent1: The paupering of the once prosperous town left its residents struggling to survive.
meanings.sent2: The paupering of the nation's economy led to widespread unemployment and hardship.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected medical bills caused the sudden paupering of the family.
meanings.sent4: The charity organization worked tirelessly to prevent the paupering of vulnerable communities.
meanings.sent5: The natural disaster resulted in the paupering of many families who lost everything they owned.
